models.name: MP Select Mini 3D Upgraded Knob
models.description:
This knob is designed to fit the MonoPrice Select Mini 3D and give you a better grasp on the knob and has the logo on top for a nice finish. Enjoy :)

** Be sure to clean the outside well as it is the same OD as the stock knob and any excess print can cause rubbing.


OD: 29.8mm
ID: 6.1mm

models.name: Power Wheels Jeep Hood Hinges
models.description:
Replica Hood hinges for Jeep WIlly's, CJ's, and Wranglers 1955-1995.

I was surprised these were hard to find.  I'm going to start a section of PowerWheels Jeep stuff.  Some stuff will be specific to an Army style Willy's spin-off.

Much cooler and more authentic looking than the stock hook connectors.

Use a #6 x 1-1/4"  (#6-32).   Or use the provided pin.  The pin's tip may need slight sanding depending on print settings.  Should be snug when pressing it through, so it doesn't come out.

models.name: Belt Maker
models.description:
This design illustrates the use of various techniques in scripting using OpenSCAD.

Features the use of:
* Parameters - to control the different dimensions of the belt
* Functions - how to call functions with optional parameters
* Variables - use of variables, both global or local
* Difference - Taking the difference() of each object (subtracting an object from another one)
* For Loop - how to increment a counter with lower and upper limits

You will need to download and install OpenSCAD or run the code through the Makerbot Customizer.

Optionally, 3D-Print the design using Semiflex filament or similar flexible material that has limited or no elasticity.

  • Functions - how to call functions with optional parameters
  • Variables - use of variables, both global or local
  • Difference - Taking the difference() of each object (subtracting an object from another one)
  • For Loop - how to increment a counter with lower and upper limits

You will need to download and install OpenSCAD or run the code through the Makerbot Customizer.

Optionally, 3D-Print the design using Semiflex filament or similar flexible material that has limited or no elasticity.

Features the use of:
* Parameters - to control the different dimensions of the belt

* Variables - use of variables, both global or local

You will need to download and install OpenSCAD or run the code through the Makerbot Customizer.

models.edu_details:
Overview and Background

Belt Maker

An OpenSCAD script that creates a belt design based on parameters given such as the diameter, height, and thickness of the belt. Optional ribs can be added.

This illustrates how one simple design can be changed to make different objects so there is no need to create different scripts for different size belts.

Lesson Plan and Activity

Technical Requirements

You will need a computer to download and install OpenSCAD (from openscad.org) or run the code through the Makerbot Customizer.

Optionally, 3D-Print the design using Semiflex filament or similar flexible material that has limited or no elasticity.

Materials Needed

Materials Needed

Optionally, 3D-Print the design using Semiflex filament or similar flexible material that has limited or no elasticity.

Can be 3d printed using rigid plastics as well but obviously can not be used as a drive belt.
